name: Collaborative Labelling and Appliance Standards Program
legal: Branch office without independent legal personality under the legal sphere of the parent CLASP USA
goal: CLASP improves the environmental and energy performance of the appliances and related systems we use every day, lessening their impacts on people and the world around us. CLASP develops and shares practical and transformative policy and market solutions in collaboration with global experts and local stakeholders. We are the leading international resource and voice for energy efficiency standards and labels (S&L) for appliances, lighting, and equipment. Since 1999, CLASP has worked in over 50 countries on 6 continents pursuing every aspect of appliance energy efficiency, from helping structure new policies to evaluating existing programs.
interests: Climate Action, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: CLASP works to support activities under the Ecodesign Directive and the Energy Labelling Directive; and also follow the Energy Efficiency Directive and the Energy Performance of Buildings Directive.
